content:
ConnectivityStatus Class

Definition

Represents the status of an application's network connection.

In this Article

public static class ConnectivityStatus
Inheritance
System.Object
ConnectivityStatus

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Use the ConnectivityStatus class to specify the network connectivity of Windows-based applications that use client application services. When you set the IsOffline property to true, the client service providers use the offline cache instead of attempting to access the corresponding Web services. The offline status is stored on a per-user and per-application basis. For more information, see How to: Work Offline with Client Application Services.

Properties

IsOffline

Gets or sets a value indicating whether an application is in offline mode.

public static bool IsOffline { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the application is in offline mode; otherwise, false.

Remarks

When you set the IsOffline property, the ConnectivityStatus class caches the value to the local file system. The client service providers in the System.Web.ClientServices.Providers namespace check this value to determine whether to use the offline data cache instead of attempting to access the associated Microsoft Ajax authentication, roles, and profile services.
